sen.j: 西京極駅（にしきょうごくえき）は、京都市右京区にある、阪急電鉄阪急京都本線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, Nishikyogoku Station is a stop on the Hankyu Kyoto Line, which is operated by the Hankyu Railway.
Nishikyogoku Station, located in Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, is a stop on the Hankyu Kyoto Line, which is operated by the Hankyu Railway.
Nishikyogoku Station, located in Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, is a stop on the Hankyu Kyoto Line, which is operated by the Hankyu Railway.

sen.j: 西京極総合運動公園前という副駅名をもつ。
sen.e: The station has a sub-station name of Nishikyogoku-sogoundokoen-mae (Nishikyogoku Comprehensive Sports Park).
The station has a sub-station name of Nishikyogoku-sogoundokoen-mae (Nishikyogoku Comprehensive Sports Park).
The station has a sub-station name of Nishikyogoku-sogoundokoen-mae (Nishikyogoku Comprehensive Sports Park).

sen.j: プラットホーム形状と配置2面2線のプラットホームを持つ、築堤上にある高架駅である。
sen.e: Nishikyogoku Station is an elevated station with two platforms serving two tracks (the form of platform and its arrangement); the station is on the banking.
Nishikyogoku Station is an elevated station with two platforms serving two tracks; the station is on the banking.
Nishikyogoku Station is an elevated station with two platforms serving two tracks; the station is on the banking.

sen.j: 改札・コンコースは1階にある。
sen.e: The ticket gate and concourse are on the first floor.
The ticket gate and concourse are on the first floor.
The ticket gate and concourse are on the first floor.

sen.j: 改札口は1か所、入口はホーム南側にある。
sen.e: There is one ticket gate; the entrance of the station is on the south side of the platform.
There is one ticket gate; the entrance of the station is on the south side of the platform.
There is one ticket gate; the entrance of the station is on the south side of the platform.

sen.j: 河原町行きホーム側にも臨時改札口があり、京都市西京極総合運動公園でのプロ野球・日本プロサッカーリーグ試合時や関西学生野球の同立戦時などに使用する。
sen.e: There is also a temporary ticket gate on the platform for Kawaramachi, which is used when the Kyoto City Nishikyogoku Comprehensive Sports Park holds matches of the professional baseball league, Japan Soccer League, or KANSAI BIG6 Baseball League (e.g. a match between Doshisha University and Ritsumeikan University).

There is also a temporary ticket gate on the platform for Kawaramachi, which is used when the Kyoto City Nishikyogoku Comprehensive Sports Park holds matches of the Professional Baseball League, Japan Soccer League or KANSAI BIG6 Baseball League (e.g., a match between Doshisha University and Ritsumeikan University).

There is also a temporary ticket gate on the platform for Kawaramachi, which is used when the Kyoto City Nishikyogoku Comprehensive Sports Park holds matches of the Professional Baseball League, Japan Soccer League or KANSAI BIG6 Baseball League (e.g., a match between Doshisha University and Ritsumeikan University).

sen.j: 大阪方面行きホームにもスロープ状の臨時改札口がある。
sen.e: There is also a slope temporary ticket gate on the platform for Osaka.
There is also a ramped temporary ticket gate on the platform for Osaka.
There is also a ramped temporary ticket gate on the platform for Osaka.

sen.j: なお河原町方面ホーム南側に、本線から分岐するような鉄橋の残骸があるが、これは新京阪鉄道時代、名古屋市までの延長計画に備え、当地に鉄道駅貨物駅を作ろうとした名残とされる。
sen.e: A trail of an iron bridge branching off the main track remains on the south of the platform for Kawaramachi, which is assumed to be a trace of the Shinkeihan Railway era, when a freight railway station was going to be built for a plan to extend a railway line to Nagoya City.

A remnant of an iron bridge branching off the main track remains on the south of the platform for Kawaramachi, which is assumed to be a trace of the Shinkeihan Railway era when a freight railway station was going to be built according to a plan to extend a railway line to Nagoya City.

A remnant of an iron bridge branching off the main track remains on the south of the platform for Kawaramachi, which is assumed to be a trace of the Shinkeihan Railway era when a freight railway station was going to be built according to a plan to extend a railway line to Nagoya City.

sen.j: ※のりば番号は設定されていない。
sen.e: ※Track numbers are not assigned.
※Track numbers aren't assigned.
Platform numbers aren't assigned.

sen.j: 平成17年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約8,611人（京都府統計書より）。
sen.e: The number of passengers per day was about 8,611 in 2005 (adapted from Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Book).
The number of passengers per day was about 8,611 in 2005 (according to the Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Book).
The number of passengers per day was about 8,611 in fiscal year 2005 (according to the Kyoto Prefecture Statistics Report).
sen.cmt: 統一しました。fiscal → fiscal yearに変更しました。

sen.e: Kyoto Nishikyogoku Athletic Stadium etc.

sen.e: Kyoto Nishikyogoku post office
The Kyoto Nishikyogoku post office

sen.e: Nishikyogoku Elementary School, Kyoto City

sen.e: Kyoto Koka Women's University

sen.e: Kadonooji-dori Street

sen.j: 阪急西京極
sen.e: Hankyu Nishikyogoku
Hankyu Nishikyogoku

sen.j: バス停は駅前ではなく、駅から徒歩2分の葛野大路通沿いにある。
sen.e: The bus stop is not in front of the station, but on the Kadonooji-dori Street, a 2-minute walk from the station.
The bus stop isn't in front of the station but on the Kadonooji-dori Street, a two-minute walk from the station.
The bus stop isn't in front of the station but on the Kadonooji-dori Street, a two-minute walk from the station.

sen.j: 京都市営バス
sen.e: Kyoto City Bus
Kyoto City Bus
Kyoto City Bus

sen.j: 84系統：太秦天神川駅行／（久世橋通経由）京都駅八条口アバンティ前行
sen.e: Route 84: for Uzumasa Tenjingawa Sta./for Kyoto Sta. Hachijoguchi Avanti-mae (via Kuzebashi-dori Street)
Route 84: Bound for Uzumasa Tenjingawa Station/for Kyoto Station Hachijoguchi Avanti-mae (via Kuzebashi-dori Street)
Route 84: Bound for Uzumasa Tenjingawa Station/for Kyoto Station Hachijoguchi Avanti-mae (via Kuzebashi-dori Street)

sen.j: 周辺部（徒歩5分程度）のバス停留所に光華女子学園前（京都市バス32系統、73系統、80系統、京都バス（京都駅～五条通～嵐山方面））、川勝寺（京都市バス特33系統、京阪京都交通）がある
sen.e: Other bus stops around the station (about a 5-minute walk) are Koka Joshi Gakuen-mae (Kyoto City Bus Route: 32, 73, 80; Kyoto Bus Co.,Ltd. (for Kyoto Station - Gojo-dori Street - Arashiyama)) and Senshoji (Kyoto City Bus Route: Special 33; Keihan Kyoto Kotsu).

Other bus stops around the station (about a five-minute walk) are Koka Joshi Gakuen-mae (Kyoto City Bus Route: 32, 73, 80; Kyoto Bus Co., Ltd. (for Kyoto Station - Gojo-dori Street - Arashiyama)) and Senshoji (Kyoto City Bus Route: Special 33; Keihan Kyoto Kotsu).

Other bus stops around the station (about a five-minute walk) are Koka Joshi Gakuen-mae (Kyoto City Bus Route: 32, 73, 80; Kyoto Bus Co., Ltd. (for Kyoto Station - Gojo-dori Street - Arashiyama)) and Senshoji (Kyoto City Bus Route: Special 33; Keihan Kyoto Kotsu).

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）11月1日 新京阪鉄道高槻町～京都西院間開通と同時に開業。
sen.e: On November 1, 1928 the station was opened when the section between Takatsuki-cho Station and Kyoto Saiin Station of the Shinkeihan Railway was opened.
November 1, 1928: the station was opened when the section between Takatsuki-cho Station and Kyoto Saiin Station of the Shinkeihan Railway was opened.
November 1, 1928: the station was opened when the section between Takatsuki-cho Station and Kyoto Saiin Station of the Shinkeihan Railway was opened.

sen.j: 1930年（昭和5年）9月15日 会社合併により京阪電気鉄道新京阪線の駅となる。
sen.e: On September 15, 1930 Nishikyogoku Station became a stop on the Shinkeihan Line operated by the Keihan Electric Railway as a result of amalgamation.
September 15, 1930: Nishikyogoku Station became a stop on the Shinkeihan Line, operated by the Keihan Electric Railway, as a result of amalgamation.
September 15, 1930: Nishikyogoku Station became a stop on the Shinkeihan Line, operated by the Keihan Electric Railway, as a result of amalgamation.

sen.j: 1943年（昭和18年）10月1日 会社合併により京阪神急行電鉄（現在の阪急電鉄）京都本線の駅となる。
sen.e: On October 1, 1943 Nishikyogoku Station came to be a stop on the Kyoto Line, which is operated by the Keihanshin Express Railway (the current Hankyu Railway) as a result of amalgamation.
October 1, 1943: Nishikyogoku Station came to be a stop on the Kyoto Line, operated by the Keihanshin Express Railway (the current Hankyu Railway), as a result of amalgamation.
October 1, 1943: Nishikyogoku Station came to be a stop on the Kyoto Line, operated by the Keihanshin Express Railway (the current Hankyu Railway), as a result of amalgamation.

sen.j: 通過
sen.e: (Commuter) Limited Express, Limited Express, and Rapid Express trains do not stop at Nishikyogoku Station.
(Commuter) limited express, limited express and rapid express trains don't stop at Nishikyogoku Station.
(Commuter) limited express, limited express and rapid express trains don't stop at Nishikyogoku Station.

sen.j: 京都市西京極総合運動公園でのプロ野球・Jリーグ試合時に合わせ、快速急行（2001年以前のダイヤでいう急行）が臨時停車することがある。
sen.e: When the Kyoto City Nishikyogoku Comprehensive Sports Park holds matches of the professional baseball league or Japan Soccer League, Rapid Express trains (called Express in the schedule of 2001 and before) temporarily stop at the station occasionally.

When the Kyoto City Nishikyogoku Comprehensive Sports Park holds matches of the Professional Baseball League or the Japan Soccer League, rapid express trains (called "express" in the schedule of 2001 and before) sometimes temporarily stop at the station.

When the Kyoto City Nishikyogoku Comprehensive Sports Park holds matches of the Professional Baseball League or the Japan Soccer League, rapid express trains (called "express" in the schedule of 2001 and before) sometimes temporarily stop at the station.
